03_central_limit_theorem/02_normal/09_bounds_from_centralarea_v3

Random variable \(C\) is normally distributed with mean \(\mu = 170\) and standard deviation \(\sigma = 50\). \[C = \text{N}(170,\,50) \]


  1. Evaluate \(d\) such that \(P\left(\big|C-170\big|<d\right) = 0.6\). In other words, determine the distance from mean of two boundaries such that this normal spinner lands within those boundaries 60% of the time.
  2. Let \(c_1 = 170-d\) and \(c_2 = 170+d\), such that \(P\left(c_1 < C < c_2\right) = 0.6\). Evaluate \(c_1\).
  3. Using the definitions above, evaluate \(c_2\)
